snippet: The Missouri House speaker called for mandatory annual sexual-harassment training after a state senator and the former speaker resigned amid allegations that they had harassed interns.
abstract: Missouri House Speaker Todd Richardson calls for mandatory annual sexual-harassment training for state lawmakers and staff; both State Sen Paul LeVota and former speaker, John Diehl, resigned over accusations they sexually harassed interns.
lead_paragraph: The Missouri House speaker called for mandatory annual sexual-harassment training after a state senator and the former speaker resigned amid allegations that they had harassed interns.

headline.print_headline: Missouri: Lawmakers May Get Training Not to Harass Interns
headline.main: Missouri: Lawmakers May Get Training Not to Harass Interns
